newsitem.title: ITALY: MOTOR RACING-FERRARI DENY TALKS WITH HILL.
newsitem.headline: MOTOR RACING-FERRARI DENY TALKS WITH HILL.

text.p: Ferrari have dismissed speculation that Damon Hill may partner Michael Schumacher in the Italian team next season.

"Ferrari categorically denies any reports regarding negotiations with other drivers and confirms, as it has on many other occasions, that the drivers for next season are Michael Schumacher and Eddie Irvine," team spokesman Giancarlo Baccini said on Monday.
"I don't think Damon Hill would be enthusiastic about the prospect of running by Schumacher's side," Baccini added.
World championship leader Hill has been linked with all the other top teams since he was rejected by Williams, who are to replace him with Heinz-Harald Frentzen of Germany at the end of the season.

Formula One ringmaster Bernie Ecclestone fed the rumours after Schumacher's victory in Sunday's Italian Grand Prix when he said: "He could go to Ferrari...why not? All the great teams have had the best drivers in the past."
